ibis.ipl.impl

Class ReceivePortConnectionInfo

  • java.lang.Object
    • ibis.ipl.impl.ReceivePortConnectionInfo

  • public class ReceivePortConnectionInfo
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents the information about a particular sendport/receiveport connection, on the receiver side.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected boolean closed 
      ibis.io.DataInputStream dataIn
      The underlying data stream for this connection.
      ibis.io.SerializationInput in
      The serialization input stream of the connection.
      protected static org.slf4j.Logger logger
      Debugging.
      ReadMessage message
      The message that arrives on this connection.
      SendPortIdentifier origin
      Identifies the sendport side of the connection.
      ReceivePort port
      The receiveport of the connection.

    • Constructor Summary

        The receiveport of the connection.

      • message

        public ReadMessage message
        The message that arrives on this connection.

      • dataIn

        public ibis.io.DataInputStream dataIn
        The underlying data stream for this connection. The serialization stream lies on top of this.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ReceivePortConnectionInfo

        public ReceivePortConnectionInfo(SendPortIdentifier origin,
                                 ReceivePort port,
                                 ibis.io.DataInputStream dataIn)
                          throws java.io.IOException
        Constructs a new ReceivePortConnectionInfo with the specified parameters.
        Parameters:
        origin - identifies the sendport of this connection.
        port - the receiveport.
        dataIn - the inputstream on which a serialization input stream can be built.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - is thrown in case of trouble.

    • Method Detail

      • bytesRead

        public long bytesRead()
        Returns the number of bytes read from the data stream.
        Returns:
        the number of bytes.

      • newStream

        public void newStream()
               throws java.io.IOException
        This method must be called each time a connected sendport adds a new connection. This new connection may either be to the current receiveport, or to another one. In both cases, the serialization stream must be recreated.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - is thrown in case of trouble.

      • close

        public void close(java.lang.Throwable e)
        This method closes the connection, as the result of the specified exception. Implementations may need to redefine this method
        Parameters:
        e - the exception.

      • upcallCalledFinish

        protected void upcallCalledFinish()
        This method gets called when the upcall for the message explicitly called ReadMessage.finish(). The default implementation just allocates a new message.

      • connectionType

        public java.lang.String connectionType()
